main event: An unidentified flying object was observed moving at a high speed across the sky in Portland, Maine on November 11, 1959.
interesting points: The object was reported to be at an altitude above 30,000 ft and the speed was described as excessive, suggesting it was not a typical weather balloon., The sighting lasted for 3-5 minutes during bright daylight conditions., The initial impression of the witness was that it could be a weather balloon, but the motion was too erratic., The object was described as round and solid, traveling at a tremendous speed., A letter from the witness mentioned that the object had a translucent glow and disappeared into the northern sky.
